page.title: 13CHURCHERS, PETERSFIELD
page.content: Churchers College was founded in l722 by Richard Churcher, an East India Company merchant, and was opened in buildings at College Street, Petersfield. In 1881 it was moved to new buildings on the present site next to the A3. In l95l it became a Voluntary Aided school maintained by Hampshire County Council, but reverted to Independent status in l976. There are about 450 boys at the school, and about a quarter are boarders. Since l980 girls have been admitted to the Sixth form. The aim of the school is to provide the means by which each boy's qualities are developed to the full, and the activities and discipline of the school are directed towards this.
